verses.kjv: Then the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied unto the Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, even unto them.
verses.web: Now the prophets, Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem. They prophesied to them in the name of the God of Israel.
verses.ct: Then the prophets Haggai and Zechariah son of Iddo brought a message from the God of Israel to the Jews living in Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem: and with them were the prophets of God helping them.
verses.web: Then Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak rose up and began to build God’s house which is at Jerusalem; and with them were the prophets of God, helping them.
verses.ct: Inspired by their words, Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak got up and began rebuilding the house of God in Jerusalem. The prophets of God were right there alongside them, helping with the work.

verses.kjv: At the same time came to them Tatnai, governor on this side the river, and Shetharboznai, and their companions, and said thus unto them, Who hath commanded you to build this house, and to make up this wall?
verses.web: At the same time Tattenai, the governor beyond the River came to them, with Shetharbozenai, and their companions, and asked them, “Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?”
verses.ct: Right away, Tatnai, the governor of the province west of the Euphrates, along with Shetharboznai and their officials, came to them and demanded, "Who authorized you to rebuild this temple and restore these walls?"

verses.kjv: Then said we unto them after this manner, What are the names of the men that make this building?
verses.web: They also asked for the names of the men were who were making this building.
verses.ct: They also asked, "What are the names of the men working on this construction?"

verses.kjv: But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, that they could not cause them to cease, till the matter came to Darius: and then they returned answer by letter concerning this matter.
verses.web: But the eye of their God was on the elders of the Jews, and they didn’t make them cease, until the matter should come to Darius, and an answer should be returned by letter concerning it.
verses.ct: But God was watching over the Jewish elders, and the officials couldn't force them to stop. Instead, the matter was sent to King Darius, and they waited for his written response.

verses.kjv: The copy of the letter that Tatnai, governor on this side the river, and Shetharboznai, and his companions the Apharsachites, which were on this side the river, sent unto Darius the king:
verses.web: The copy of the letter that Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, and Shetharbozenai, and his companions the Apharsachites, who were beyond the River, sent to Darius the king follows.
verses.ct: Here is a copy of the letter that Tatnai, the governor of the province west of the Euphrates, along with Shetharboznai and his associates the Apharsachites from that same region, sent to King Darius:

verses.kjv: They sent a letter unto him, wherein was written thus; Unto Darius the king, all peace.
verses.web: They sent a letter to him, in which was written: To Darius the king, all peace.
verses.ct: In their letter, they wrote: "To King Darius — greetings and peace.

verses.kjv: Be it known unto the king, that we went into the province of Judea, to the house of the great God, which is builded with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and this work goeth fast on, and prospereth in their hands.
verses.web: Be it known to the king that we went into the province of Judah, to the house of the great God, which is built with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls. This work goes on with diligence and prospers in their hands.
verses.ct: Your Majesty should know that we traveled to the province of Judah and visited the temple of the great God. It is being built with large stones, and timber is being set into the walls. The work is moving ahead quickly and making great progress.

verses.kjv: Then asked we those elders, and said unto them thus, Who commanded you to build this house, and to make up these walls?
verses.web: Then we asked those elders, and said to them thus, “Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?”
verses.ct: We questioned the elders there and asked them, 'Who authorized you to rebuild this temple and restore these walls?'

verses.kjv: We asked their names also, to certify thee, that we might write the names of the men that were the chief of them.
verses.web: We asked them their names also, to inform you that we might write the names of the men who were at their head.
verses.ct: We also asked for their names so we could report them to you and write down the names of their leaders.

verses.kjv: And thus they returned us answer, saying, We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was builded these many years ago, which a great king of Israel builded and set up.
verses.web: Thus they returned us answer, saying, “We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and are building the house that was built these many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and finished.
verses.ct: This is the answer they gave us: 'We are servants of the God of heaven and earth, and we are rebuilding the temple that was originally constructed many years ago by a great king of Israel.

verses.kjv: But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven unto wrath, he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.
verses.web: But after our fathers had provoked the God of heaven to wrath, he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.
verses.ct: But because our ancestors provoked the God of heaven to anger, he handed them over to Nebuchadnezzar, the Chaldean king of Babylon, who destroyed this temple and deported the people to Babylon.

verses.kjv: But in the first year of Cyrus the king of Babylon the same king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God.
verses.web: But in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, Cyrus the king made a decree to build this house of God.
verses.ct: However, in the 1st year of King Cyrus of Babylon, Cyrus issued a decree authorizing the rebuilding of this house of God.

verses.kjv: And the vessels also of gold and silver of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought them into the temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered unto one, whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor;
verses.web: The gold and silver vessels of God’s house, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought into the temple of Babylon, those Cyrus the king also took out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered to one whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor.
verses.ct: On top of that, Cyrus removed from the temple in Babylon all the gold and silver articles that Nebuchadnezzar had originally taken from the temple in Jerusalem. He handed them over to a man named Sheshbazzar, whom he had appointed as governor.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Take these vessels, go, carry them into the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be builded in his place.
verses.web: He said to him, ‘Take these vessels, go, put them in the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let God’s house be built in its place.’
verses.ct: Cyrus told him, 'Take these articles back to the temple in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be rebuilt on its original site.'

verses.kjv: Then came the same Sheshbazzar, and laid the foundation of the house of God which is in Jerusalem: and since that time even until now hath it been in building, and yet it is not finished.
verses.web: Then the same Sheshbazzar came and laid the foundations of God’s house which is in Jerusalem. Since that time even until now it has been being built, and yet it is not completed.
verses.ct: So Sheshbazzar came and laid the foundation of the house of God in Jerusalem. Construction has continued from that day to this, but it still isn't finished.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let there be search made in the king’s treasure house, which is there at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.
verses.web: Now therefore, if it seems good to the king, let a search be made in the king’s treasure house, which is there at Babylon, whether it is so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem; and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.”
verses.ct: So if it pleases the king, we ask that a search be made in the royal archives there in Babylon to confirm whether King Cyrus actually issued a decree to rebuild this house of God in Jerusalem. Then please send us the king's decision on this matter."
